headline.main: At a Nutrition Conference, a Bland Diet

docs.abstract: Research confirming connection between food advertising, marketing and problems of overweight and obesity is studiously avoided at the National Nutrition Summit in Washington; this in part reflects fact that Agriculture Department's mission is not only to advise Americans on nutrition but also to promote American agricultural products like beef and milk; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: DESPITE research confirming the connection between food advertising, marketing and the problems of overweight and obesity, the subject was studiously avoided at the National Nutrition Summit in Washington last week. The meeting, convened by the Agriculture and Health and Human Services Departments, was well attended by the food industry. ''You can't talk about it,'' said Dr. Marion Nestle, the chairwoman of the New York University nutrition and food studies department, one of a handful of speakers who raised questions about the relationship of the food industry to consumption patterns. ''It's totally ignored.''
